lead_paragraph: Pasquale D’Amuro, the bureau’s assistant director for counterterrorism, asks James Baker for approval to use evidence gathered for intelligence purposes for a criminal prosecution.

headline.main: F.B.I. Memorandum From June 4, 2002, on the Possibility of Filing Prostitution-Related Charges Against Anwar al-Awlaki

snippet: Pasquale D’Amuro, the bureau’s assistant director for counterterrorism, asks James Baker for approval to use evidence gathered for intelligence purposes for a criminal prosecution.
